programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.desc: Dance Hall madness from Jamaica

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past (2014)
programme.desc: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants

programme.title: Avengers: Infinity War (2018)
programme.desc: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe

programme.title: Aquaman (2018)
programme.desc: A family of undercover superheroes, while trying to live the quiet suburban life, are forced into action to save the world

programme.title: Black Panther (2018)
programme.desc: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Rachel Burden present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Worship
programme.desc: The Rev Canon Leigh Richardson, sub dean and precentor, leads the service for the second Sunday after Easter from St Davids Cathedral in Pembrokeshire. With hymns sung by a Songs of Praise congregation recorded in July 2019 and filmed before the closure of all church buildings was announced.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Persephone and Debbie sample life in New Zealand, believing the country to offer a more attractive culture and society for same sex couples.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell and Martin Roberts follow the progress of terraced houses in Frizington in Cumbria and Wolverhampton and a huge commercial building in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Caroline Hawley advise the two teams as they scour Kingston Antiques Centre in south-west London, while Natasha Raskin Sharp oversees proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: In a programme filmed before the current restrictions, Aled Jones visits the Salvation Army's Strawberry Field centre in Liverpool, a training hub for young people with learning difficulties and home to a visitor exhibition exploring the site's links to John Lennon.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Guy Mowbray looks back at memorable semi-finals, featuring Everton v Liverpool from 1977 and Chesterfield v Middlesbrough from 1997. Both matches are remembered for their controversial moments, with Everton and Chesterfield feeling aggrieved by decisions that ultimately helped their opponents progress to the finals.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus Daily Update: BBC News Special
Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The Rich brothers and Charlie Dimmock travel to Milton Keynes, compete for the chance to create a barbecue-friendly, brightly planted, Hindu-inspired garden for Vinay and Raunak.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the first edition of a new look for the programme, Anita Rani is on her home patch in east London to discover what lockdown means for Woodberry Wetlands and what the future holds for the animals of Hackney City Farm. At home, she gets stuck into reinvigorating her garden and cooks up a barbecue tandoori. Adam Henson reveals the effects of the pandemic on farming and Tom Heap investigates how a new British land army might work for fruit and veg growers.(n)

programme.title: One World: Together at Home
programme.desc: Highlights of the music and entertainment event supporting the Covid-19 Response Fund and celebrating the efforts of community health workers around the world, brought together by Global Citizen and the World Health Organisation, curated in collaboration with Lady Gaga. Featuring performances by stars including Elton John, Lizzo and Stevie Wonder.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.desc: Villanelle is approached by an old foe who offers her a new opportunity, while Eve attempts to rebuild her life after having been shot and left for dead in Rome. Kenny tries to unearth information about the Twelve, and Carolyn is undermined at work. The return of the spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: The Deer Hunter
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and Jack Monroe are joined by a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link, demonstrating a range of dishes to inspire the audience.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell revisits a bungalow in Tipton, Dion Dublin meets father-and-daughter developers in Burnley and Martin Roberts examines the potential of three flats in Lewisham, south-east London.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles introduces more footage of near misses, featuring the rescue of a hiker who was searching for his dog when a cliff crumbled beneath his feet.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion oversees proceedings in the north-west of England as experts David Harper and Gary Pe help two teams buy their three items to take to auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: It is Jimmi's first day back at work and he meets some patients who put his strength, resolve and medical skills to the test. Medical drama, starring Adrian Lewis Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest joins in the search for a girl who is believed to be radioactive, and tries to find out who is responsible for her overnight disappearance. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek and Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple hoping to relocate to rural Somerset on a budget of Â£700,000, looking for a home with enough land for animals and a glamping site. Away from the hunt, Alistair gets stuck in with some Cheddar making in the county where it originated.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander returns with the programme in which entrepreneurs' products are put to the test, with the inventors watching as consumers unbox, try out and give feedback. In the opening edition, they pass judgement on a make-up tool, an oven-proof breadmaker and a bicycle mirror.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton take a tour of south-east England, along the way encountering items including a potter's wheel, before an auction in Tring, Hertfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Four weeks into the Government's lockdown to save lives and protect the NHS, Jane Corbin reports from the frontline to tell the inside story of how a Coventry hospital is coping with Covid-19. She hears from doctors and nurses saving lives and dealing with death every day and asks whether there is enough protective equipment and testing to help protect them from the daily risks to their own health.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tiffany berates Keegan for his bad mood and the chaos at the Taylors' only adds to his stress, leading to an angry outburst - but he is mortified to realise Bailey has witnessed his violent. Sonia urges Whitney to get back to normal, but that proves easier said than done with Michaela posting disagreeable online comments online, leaving her crushed. Ash cries on Vinny's shoulder but they both panic when Suki arrives home early, and after speaking to Callum, Stuart is inspired to propose to Rainie again.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Bake Off judge Prue Leith, reality TV star Scarlett Moffatt, rapper Big Narstie and weatherman Tomasz Schafernaker join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A student backpacker is found dead in the showers of her hostel, and with a gun in her hand and her body slumped against the only door, all evidence points toward suicide. Humphrey isn't so sure, however, especially when he notices all her toiletries laid out and her towel missing. But when the team question the victim's boyfriend and her fellow backpackers, they find themselves with very little to go on. Meanwhile, JP prepares for the biggest day of his life as his wedding day approaches, and when Humphrey bumps into an old lady friend, Florence encourages her boss to pursue his quest for love.(n)

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: With a contract out on Officer Harper's life, Mobeen steps in to try and save him and take him out of the firing line. Eight and Nate must stall the would-be assassin long enough for Mobeen and Harper to escape through the woods.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Dragons' Den investor Deborah Meaden and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The Bafta-award-winning host is back to review trending news stories before making online contact with guests Patrick Stewart, Ricky Gervais and Thandie Newton. Plus, more viewers recount an anecdote, desperate to avoid rejection, and there's music by Christine and the Queens.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined in the studio by food writer Jack Monroe and a range of culinary talent from across the country taking part by live link, demonstrating a range of dishes to inspire the audience.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the stories of properties in Nuneaton, Wolverhampton and Stoke that are being transformed before being sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles presents footage of an angler fishing on a rock who is swept into a raging sea, and a mountain biker whose attempt at a stunt does not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning presents from Anglesey's Mona Showground where two brothers taken on a mother and daughter team, with expert help from Caroline Hawley and Philip Serrell.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi and Emma try to put the past behind them, Daniel and Zara are worried about Joe's new friend, and Ayesha helps a father reconnect with his son, who is in a new relationship.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the disappearance of a parishioner who believed she was being haunted by her sister, who went missing years before. Mark Williams stars in the 1950s-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Sorcha Cusack, Hugo Speer and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from Surrey town to find a new home in the Welsh Borders, and also goes behind the scenes with conservation work at the Slimbridge Wetland Centre.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Customers unbox and try out weighted blankets to help children sleep, car cleaning products, and a microwaveable vegan mug cake made that can be baked in just 60 seconds..(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton take a tour of Northamptonshire and Bedfordshire. Items up for sale include a ring made of lava from Mount Vesuvius and depleted uranium glassware.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kush continues to hide Tommy's secret and while dropping him off at school, he asks Isaac to keep an eye on him. Denise is stunned to learn what happened to Keegan and Jean receives a gift from Daniel, leaving her touched.(n)

programme.title: Life and Birth
programme.desc: Documentary revealing what it really takes to deliver Britain's next generation through the eyes of parents and staff at three of Birmingham's busiest maternity hospitals. The programme goes beyond the labour ward to meet parents at every stage of their pregnancy, capturing the work of midwives, doctors and surgeons dedicated to supporting families as they bring new lives into the world. In the first episode, Channelle wants an intervention free birth, Jodie's baby arrives eight weeks early, and there is joy for Ashleigh after a dramatic delivery.(n)

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Georgie struggles with being placed on reduced duties, while some difficult sessions with a psychiatrist force her to confront some home truths. Fearing that her military career is over, she steals Antonio's security pass so that she and Prof can confront Omar in his cell. However, his reactions leave her convinced that something is wrong, but does not think anyone will believe her. She does not realise that the man in the cell is one of Omar's followers, who has taken his place so the terrorist leader can plan a major attack.(n)

programme.title: Hot Property
programme.desc: Yung Filly comes to the aid of a bartender who has never had a girlfriend, giving him the chance to snoop around the homes of three potential partners.(n)

programme.title: Addicted: America's Opioid Crisis
programme.desc: Documentary exploring America's prescription opioid addiction crisis, which has led to 130 fatal overdoses a day, as well as being a gateway drug to heroin. The programme examines the pharmaceutical company Purdue Pharma, owned by the philanthropic Sackler family, which has made billions from the sale of the drugs, and questions why medical regulators and government agencies have not done more to prevent the scale of the addiction crisis.(n)

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: As the Coronavirus takes hold around the world, Global Questions invites its international audience to put their questions to a panel of experts on the risks to global health. Have lessons already been learned from the global response and how countries have handled the crisis in different ways. Join Zeinab Badawi and two leading international figures; the former Prime Minister of Denmark Helle Thorning-Schmidt and Richard Horton the Editor in Chief of the independent international Medical Journal the Lancet who will be answering your questions from around the world.(n)

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: It may be a global pandemic but Covid 19 has hardly united the world around a collective response. We've seen world leaders focus on national self-interest rather than international collaboration. That could spell disaster for those countries least able to cope with a protracted public health crisis. Stephen Sackur speaks to David Miliband, President of the international charity the International Rescue Committee and a former UK Foreign Secretary. What kind of world will emerge from this pandemic?(n)

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: The leader of the richest and most powerful nation on earth has just cut funding for the UN agency dedicated to the fight against global disease. What does this say about the ability of the international community to join forces to combat the threat of Covid-19? Stephen Sackur speaks to the former British Prime Minister Gordon Brown who is leading an effort to get G20 leaders to commit to a massive joint response to the pandemic. Is there any hope of real global cooperation in the current geopolitical climate?(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The presenters pick out their favourite films from the programme's archive, including Anita Rani surfing in Snowdonia, Ellie Harrison counting gannets, Matt Baker visiting an alpaca blood bank and Helen Skelton going fell running. Plus, Adam Henson is on his farm finding out about the pecking order of his chickens.(n)

programme.title: Heavenly Gardens with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: Part two of two. Alexander and Arit Anderson visit gardens expressing hope, joy and renewal. At the Bishop's Palace in Wells, Somerset, Alexander discovers why this place has been sacred for centuries, and helps to create a colourful and uplifting work of art. Arit learns how the ancient trees at Scone Palace in Perthshire will be given a new lease of life, and Alexander heads to his home county of Northumberland to tour a garden using humour to plant seeds of change in the community.(n)

programme.title: The British Garden: Life and Death on Your Lawn
programme.desc: Chris Packham and a group of experts spend 12 months scrutinising the wildlife in eight gardens on a suburban street in Welwyn Garden City. Throughout the seasons they find male crickets that bribe females with food during sex, spiders that change colour to help catch prey, and ferocious life-and-death battles in the compost heap. They also shows a different side to familiar garden residents, revealing how a robin's red breast is actually war paint, and a single litter of foxes can have up to five different fathers.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: For the first time ever, the Beechgrove presenters give weekly updates from their own patches of Scotland, beginning with Carole Baxter in Aberdeenshire.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the North West go head to head to cook their six-course menus again. Not only do they need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton and broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, but also bestselling children's author and Laureate between 2011 and 2013 Julia Donaldson, who has sold over 65 million books worldwide and been translated into over 75 languages. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their celebration of British food. The culinary duo share fascinating stories as they explore the festivals and occasions that allow the nation to put on a spread and indulge.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison use virtual reality to redesign a 1930s Surrey house with a poorly designed layout to make better use of the space, and allow the owners to both start a family and have their parents move in with them in the future. Laura's plan involves turning the property into a light-filled interconnected series of spaces, while Robert turns conventional wisdom on its head with a visually striking and flexible design. After experiencing both potential houses, the owners must choose which they would like to put into practice.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's tour of the West Country continues as he explores the Forest of Dean. He enlists the aid of local wildlife enthusiasts to track down imposing wild boar, which have returned to the area for the first time in 300 years. He also has a close encounter with a goshawk, a bird of prey that specialises in hunting in woodland, and one that has come to be known locally as 'the phantom of the forest'.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1982 World Championship final between Ray Reardon and Alex Higgins, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Alex Higgins: The People's Champion
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates a look back at the often controversial life of the two-time world snooker champion, who was widely regarded as one of the most naturally gifted players in the history of his sport, but whose brilliance was flawed by his demons. With contributions by members of his family, as well as fellow snooker greats Jimmy White, Ronnie O'Sullivan, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a foundry in France that produces iron pots and pans at the rate of one every five seconds, while Cherry Healey is in South Africa, at one of the world's largest iron ore mines, and rides in a giant dumper truck. Historian Ruth Goodman explains how cooking in pots has evolved, from communal ovens to 1970s slow cookers.(n)

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels across Central America, from the Caribbean to the Pacific. Along the way, he goes diving on a coral reef on the coast of Belize, and witnesses a gun battle between park rangers and intruders in Chiquibul National Park. He also discovers how climate change has left Guatemala devastated by famine and drought, reports on measures to curb gang violence in El Salvador, and learns how Costa Rica aims to become the world's first carbon neutral country by 2021.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: After a frantic race to make it to Ilha Grande, the teams set off for the next checkpoint in Mendoza, Western Argentina, but as the race enters its final phase, the depleted budgets begin to take their toll on the competitors. Emon and Jamiul are the first to set off, but disagree about the best route to take. Jen and Rob are the team with the most money remaining, but also have clashing priorities over how best to proceed. Jo and Sam look for jobs that include bed and board to save their money, while Dom and Lizzie hitch a ride and receive an unexpected invitation.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley: Locked Up With the Lifers
programme.desc: The presenter visits a women's prison in America that has adopted a radical new approach to incarceration based on giving the inmates a sense of purpose and self-esteem. She meets eight prisoners who are serving life sentences for murder, and discovers the complex sexual relationships that have developed among many of the inmates.(n)

programme.title: Trigonometry
programme.desc: Gemma is running out of options to save the cafe, but when Ray comes up with a solution, it highlights a problem in their relationship with Gemma. The three come to the conclusion that they have to tell their families the truth about their relationship, a decision which has unforeseen consequences for all the people in their lives - but leaves them determined to make an even bigger commitment.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Homemade Show
programme.desc: Rough-and-ready self-made comedy show featuring Scottish comedian Limmy, aka Brian Limond. Limmy reveals his secret life as a hitman, gives sneaky advice to youngsters and explains why he's paranoid about hanging his minging towel on the washing line. Plus, a businessman has a crisis of confidence when he accidentally goes to put his kettle in the fridge.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Sitcom spin-off from the movie in which a documentary crew follow the lives of a group of vampire housemates in New York. Ottoman warlord Nandor, British dandy Laszlo, seductive Nadja, tedious 'energy vampire' Colin, and human servant Guillermo receive a visit from their dark lord, who demands to know why they have yet to conquer the United States. Starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak and Natasia Demetriou, and written and directed by the original movie's stars Taika Waititi and Jemaine Clement.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The vampires get involved in Staten Island local politics as their first step on the road to world domination. Starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak and Natasia Demetriou.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Fraud Squad NHS
programme.desc: The investigators look into an IT support worker shamelessly helping himself to hospital computers and a gang illegally fly-tipping on an industrial scale.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Xavier is determined to prove that Cameron killed Evan as the day of the disciplinary hearing dawns, but he may not be able to gather enough evidence to clear his name. Essie faces her first round of chemotherapy, and Sacha begs her to tell her family and friends the truth. Nicky is given the opportunity to carry out a challenging heart transplant under Jac's supervision.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers. Here, the team at one of the country's biggest shopping malls installs a three-metre tall reindeer for Christmas shoppers. In Tynemouth the biggest fish catch of the year is landed with only hours to process the catch, while refuse collectors work hard to get Newcastle's streets clean and waste recycled before dawn breaks.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining 16 contestants are split into two groups as they compete for the chance of their first taste of working in a professional kitchen. The first eight cook a dish for John Torode and Gregg Wallace, with the best five heading to Da Terra in east London to work under chef Rafael Cagali. During a busy lunch service, the amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers. Will any buckle under the intense pressure as they cook in a demanding new environment?(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Ian and Toby from Essex and Charley and David also from Essex compete for a chance to meet today's curious collector Charlie. With Â£1,000 at stake in the Curiosity Shop, who will curate the most valuable collection? Paul Martin hosts.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King travel the country to examine the UK's obsession with teatime treats. They make Bakewell tart in its original Derbyshire home and prepare a Victoria sandwich for the ladies of the WI. At Henley regatta, the duo prepare cookies with sour cherries and chocolate chips, and later serve afternoon tea to the Tees Rowing Club.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Steve Davis v Jimmy White. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1984 World Championship final, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott takes Len Goodman on a road trip around Britain to expand the Strictly Come Dancing judge's culinary horizons. The pair begin in Manchester, where Len has his first taste of Chinese food and samples some Mexican mezcal, while Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a stir-fried beef dish inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts David Harper and Claire Rawle search for items to sell at auction at Penrhyn Castle in north Wales. Presented by Paul Martin.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Amanda Abbington, Michael Buerk, Shappi Khorsandi and Elis James test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Poultry farmers Nick and Jacob and organic and heritage fruit and vegetable farmer Patrick display their wares at Alexandra Palace Farmer's Market.(n)

programme.title: The Brecon Beacons with Iolo Williams
programme.desc: Part one of two. wildlife expert e explores the unique scenery of the Brecon Beacons over the course of a year, braving the elements in each season to detail the ever-changing landscape of the valleys. He begins in the winter enduring a raging blizzard on the high peaks, while the lowlands are bathed in sun. Later, nesting is in full swing as spring arrives and while hundreds of dotterel are resting in the Black Mountains during their journey from Africa to breeding sites in Scotland, peregrines are nesting in an old quarry in the Central Beacons.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the fifth semi-final of the quiz, inviting four returning contenders to brave the black chair once more. They answer questions on the specialist subjects of the Trans-Siberian Railway, Dusty Springfield, the Monty Python films and Grayson Perry, before they each have two minutes to demonstrate their general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as the competition reaches its climax after getting under way last July, when 28 teams entered the contest with high hopes. They were gradually whittled dow to the final two after a grand total of 36 first- and second-round matches, then the quarter- and semi-finals. The two teams will be endeavouring to succeed last year's winners the University of Edinburgh and become the 49th champions of the quiz, carrying off the trophy designed by Manchester sculptor Adrian Moakes.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: The Restaurant That Burns Off Calories
programme.desc: Maitre d' Fred Sirieix and doctor Zoe Williams open a restaurant with a difference, welcoming 20 unsuspecting diners for a slap-up meal. It all sounds normal enough, but at the back of house is a fully functioning gym, where a group of fitness fanatics are poised on exercise bikes, treadmills and rowing machines, ready to burn off every single calorie ordered and consumed by the diners. This experiment is based on scientific research that suggests that people eat 20 percent less when shown how much effort it takes to remove excess calories.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: According to one report, the three most stressful experiences in life are the death of a spouse, divorce, and imprisonment. Moving house is only 32nd on the list, but anything can happen in this tale involving the Handle Me Gently removals company and a nervous resident. Written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Emilia Fox, Monica Dolan and Nick Moran.(n)

programme.title: The Mini Mash Report
programme.desc: Highlights from the satirical news show, presented by Nish Kumar, as a cast of comedy correspondents give their take on the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Sicily: Wonder of the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Part one of two. Michael Scott traces the history of Sicily, from the first arrival of ancient Greek settlers 3,000 years ago to the arrival of the Byzantine Empire. He begins his journey on the slopes of Mount Etna, Europe's largest active volcano, and discovers how the Greeks began to settle on Sicily's east coast - planting their olives and vines and building great city states that soon came to rival even Athens itself.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Making a living in farming today is hard work and taking big risks can help a farm survive. Here, three inspirational farming families are celebrated for their ideas and ingenuity, but only one can be crowned Diversification Farmer of the Year at the Farmers Weekly Awards held in London. Narrated by Denis Lawson.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The presenters pick out their favourite films from the programme's archive, including Anita Rani surfing in Snowdonia, Ellie Harrison counting gannets, Matt Baker visiting an alpaca blood bank and Helen Skelton going fell running. Plus, Adam Henson is on his farm finding out about the pecking order of his chickens.(n)

programme.title: Miriam's Big Fat Adventure
programme.desc: Part one of two. Actress Miriam Margolyes travels around the nation to discover why so many people are overweight, despite so much information about healthy lifestyles. She wants to understand what impact being obese has on people and how the rest of society views them and begins by meeting people fighting back against their size - both physically and psychologically.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles introduces more footage of near misses, featuring the rescue by the Coastguard of a hiker who was searching for his dog when a cliff crumbled beneath his feet.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams at the Peterborough Festival of Antiques find themselves in the capable hands of experts Stephanie Connell and Philip Serrell, trying to bag items they can make a profit on at auction. As well as monitoring proceedings, presenter Eric Knowles has an intriguing mystery to solve.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. The first arrival at the barn is Eloise McKenna from Kent, who hopes a large alabaster light shade that belongs to her sister can be repaired by art conservator Lucia Scalisi. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher takes a look at an old piano stool, which has been handed down through four generations of a family. Elsewhere, experts Richard Biggs and Dominic Chinea turn their attention to restoring a toy bus and a pair of binoculars.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts as David and Sally from Suffolk take on Carolle and Julie from Southampton, competing to build the most valuable collection of antiques for a chance to win Â£1,000.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers Shorts
programme.desc: Simon King and Dave Myers delve into the world of celebration cakes and face their biggest challenge to date..(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Neil Robertson v Mark Selby. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the semi-final at the 2014 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott and Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman arrive in Bristol, where Len has his first taste of Jamaican food and samples some Spanish cold soup. Meanwhile, Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a dish inspired by his heritage.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Penrhyn Castle in north Wales, experts Adam Partridge and David Harper come across a rare first edition of Dracula and a colourful Victorian watercolour set. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin gets to try his hand at splitting slate while learning about one of Wales' oldest industries.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, journalist and newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Two families of pig farmers are hoping to turn their dreams into a reality and win the top prizes with their precious livestock at the Royal Norfolk Show.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: After a frantic race to make it to Ilha Grande, the teams set off for the next checkpoint in Mendoza, Western Argentina, but as the race enters its final phase, the depleted budgets begin to take their toll on the competitors. Emon and Jamiul are the first to set off, but disagree about the best route to take. Jen and Rob are the team with the most money remaining, but also have clashing priorities over how best to proceed. Jo and Sam look for jobs that include bed and board to save their money, while Dom and Lizzie hitch a ride and receive an unexpected invitation.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison come up with virtual reality designs to transform a Halifax couple's 19th-century home. When owner Paula developed MS, it became vital to make the house more wheelchair accessible - but her partner Jeremy also sees an opportunity to give it a stylish new look. Laura's concept makes the most of the views of the garden and uses clever recycling tricks to stretch the budget, while Robert deploys off-the-shelf materials to making the place more accessible.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a soup factory in Wigan that produces 2.5 million cans a day, and follows the production of a tin of vegetable soup from a pea harvest to the eventual dispatch. He also encounters a pressure cooker that stands 27.4 metres tall. Cherry Healey compares the vitamin content of fresh and frozen vegetables, and visits a salt mine in Crewe, while historian Ruth Goodman cooks up a butterted spinach soup using a recipe from a 17th-century cookbook, which is the earliest known reference to soup in English.(n)

programme.title: I'll Get This - Extra Helping
programme.desc: Extended version of the show in which five celebrities go out for dinner together. Kelly Osbourne, Ade Edmondson, Sara Pascoe, Jermaine Jenas and Nicola Coughlan play a series of games, with the overall loser picking up the bill for the whole group.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Emily Maitlis presents analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: The Restaurant That Burns Off Calories
programme.desc: Maitre d' Fred Sirieix and doctor Zoe Williams open a restaurant with a difference, welcoming 20 unsuspecting diners for a slap-up meal. It all sounds normal enough, but at the back of house is a fully functioning gym, where a group of fitness fanatics are poised on exercise bikes, treadmills and rowing machines, ready to burn off every single calorie ordered and consumed by the diners. This experiment is based on scientific research that suggests that people eat 20 percent less when shown how much effort it takes to remove excess calories.(n)

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the fishing village of Port Isaac in Cornwall, discovering a place where people exploited a range of natural resources to make a living and find profits far beyond Britain's shores.(n)

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming explores the English canal network. A low canal tunnel in Staffordshire proves to be problematic, and Robbie helps out a stranded boater.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the connections between the wildlife, landscape and people of the Arabian peninsula. The first edition features animals including oryxes, jerboas, horned vipers and scorpions, and a journey with the Bedouin - camel-riding nomads who are the only humans to have mastered the art of survival in the desert. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.(n)

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
programme.desc: A woman and her lover elope, pursued by her jealous suitor and his lovesick admirer. They all fall under the spell of a mischievous fairy, causing their feelings for each other to run wild. Elsewhere, a bumbling troupe of would-be thespians is having difficulty in performing their play when the leading man undergoes a strange transformation. Russell T Davies's adaptation of Shakespeare's comedy, starring Maxine Peake, Matt Lucas and John Hannah.(n)

programme.title: One-Hit Wonders at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of hits by artists that were hardly heard from again after one of their songs climbed to the pinnacle of pop, alongside an analysis of the 'one-hit wonder' phenomenon. Featuring Peter Sarstedt's 1969 track Where Do You Go To (My Lovely)?, Trio's 1982 smash Da Da Da, Move Closer, by Phyllis Nelson, and You Get What You Give, by New Radicals.(n)

programme.title: Jago: A Life Underwater
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Rohani - an 80-year-old Indonesian hunter who hobbles around on land, but once he hits the water is able to dive like a fish on a single breath, descending to great depths for several minutes to stalk his prey like a true underwater predator.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Bolton
programme.desc: Oxford historian Dr Janina Ramirez sets reformed forger Shaun Greenhalgh his hardest task yet - to carve an Islamic bottle out of rock crystal in the style of the 10th-century Egyptian Fatimids. Rock crystal is notoriously fragile and sourcing the right quantities of it is almost impossible, but the real problems begin when the carving is finished.(n)

programme.title: Becoming a Lied Singer: Thomas Quasthoff and the Art of German Song
programme.desc: Drawing on his multiple roles as maestro, teacher and founder of the Das Lied International singing competition, Thomas Quasthoff takes audiences on a personal journey into this short, but intensely expressive art form. He focuses on Franz Schubert as the first great Lieder writer, and in Hamburg delves into the life and work of Johannes Brahms, a composer he feels a great empathy with. The programme includes rare archive footage of Thomas performing with pianist AndrÃ¡s Schiff in 2003 (prior to his retirement from the classical stage), as well as a newly restored telerecording of Thomas's Lied singing hero, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau.(n)

programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.desc: Art historian Professor Richard Clay explores how the idea of utopia has been re-invented by generations of writers and artists. He also examines what utopian visions reveal about our deepest hopes, dreams and fears. Among the contrributors is Star Trek actress Nichelle Nichols.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the connections between the wildlife, landscape and people of the Arabian peninsula. The first edition features animals including oryxes, jerboas, horned vipers and scorpions, and a journey with the Bedouin - camel-riding nomads who are the only humans to have mastered the art of survival in the desert. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers tips and advice as demonstrates his painting technique as he creates tranquil scenes taken from nature, beginning with mountains, evergreens, paths and bushes.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Maps
programme.sub-title: Medieval Maps - Mapping the Medieval Mind
programme.desc: Cartography through the ages, beginning with the Hereford Mappa Mundi, the largest intact medieval wall map in the world, which was intended to picture all of human knowledge in a single image. The programme traces its history, and features interviews with people who have been affected by it, including Turner Prize-winning artist Grayson Perry.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The classicist takes a look at the history of the ancient city, putting aside the bloody stories of emperors and armies to learn about the ordinary Roman on the street. Her travels take her from the Via Appia roadway, originally built in 312 BC, to the Colosseum and Monte Testaccio, an artificial hill made of broken crockery. Along the way, she tells the stories of a slave-turned-baker who made a fortune out of the grain trade, building his tomb in the shape of a giant bread-oven, three prisoners of war and a purple-dye seller whose raw material was imported from Tunisia.(n)

programme.title: Da Vinci: The Lost Treasure
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce travels to Florence, Milan, Paris and Warsaw to tell the story of Leonardo da Vinci's life, exploring why a man whose reputation rests on only a few pictures - including the Mona Lisa - is regarded as one of the greatest painters of all time. She also visits New York to see a recently discovered piece by the artist.(n)

programme.title: Patrick Kielty's Mulholland Drive
programme.desc: Patrick Kielty's journey to find the truth about Belfast-born William Mulholland, who was responsible for building Los Angeles' water infrastructure and providing a water supply that allowed the city to grow into one of the largest in the world. Patrick's family all worked for the water company in Northern Ireland and upon discovering that the man who gave LA its water was from Belfast, decided to find out why he isn't globally recognised.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.sub-title: Knights of the Road: The Highwayman's Story
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis explores the criminal underworld of Britain in the 17th and 18th centuries, beginning with the arrival of the highwayman in the wake of the English Civil War. Heavily romanticised in literature, these glamorous gangsters became a social menace on the roads and a political thorn in the side of the creaking British state, but a far darker reality lay underneath the dashing image of stylish robbers on horseback.(n)

programme.title: The Search for the Lost Manuscript: Julian of Norwich
programme.desc: Historian Dr Janina Ramirez tells the story of the first book written in English by a woman, Revelations of Divine Love by Julian of Norwich. The book was written in 1373 and presents an alternative viewpoint on man's relationship with God, which led to it being suppressed for more than 500 years. She travels from Norwich to Cambrai in Northern France, revealing how the book survived and the stories of women who championed it, and consults with academics and theologians about the book's importance.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Books
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of Books: Swallows and Amazons
programme.desc: Broadcaster John Sergeant takes to the water to explore the origins of Arthur Ransome's children's classic about the adventures of a group of children.(n)

programme.title: Life Is a Circus
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of homeless people in Oxford over the course of a year, as they come together to devise and stage an original piece of theatre.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers tips and advice as demonstrates his painting technique as he creates tranquil scenes taken from nature, beginning with mountains, evergreens, paths and bushes.(n)

programme.title: Da Vinci: The Lost Treasure
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce travels to Florence, Milan, Paris and Warsaw to tell the story of Leonardo da Vinci's life, exploring why a man whose reputation rests on only a few pictures - including the Mona Lisa - is regarded as one of the greatest painters of all time. She also visits New York to see a recently discovered piece by the artist.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints an American south western mountain scene, with red peaks looming over a lazy, tree-lined stream.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Maps
programme.sub-title: London: City Maps - Order Out of Chaos
programme.desc: The series heads for the British Library to look at maps of London, examining how representations of the city have changed over the course of three centuries. Among the documents examined are maps of the capital after the devastating fire of 1666, a neo-Classical interpretation of the city from 1746, and a map depicting sites of personal significance produced by contemporary cartographer Stephen Walter.(n)

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison: The Search for Modern Medicines
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how scientists exploited the natural world to make medicines, beginning by investigating the challenges they faced trying to create a drug that would alleviate pain. The programme examines what physical discomfort actually is, why people want to control it, and how the discovery of morphine led to 200 years of scientific breakthroughs and self-experimentation.(n)

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following scientists studying some of the world's most dangerous active volcanoes in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The series begins by exploring Nyiragongo, which has erupted twice in the past 50 years, most recently in 2002, when it devastated the nearby city of Goma. However, it lies in a region troubled by war and humanitarian crises, which has made study of the volcano difficult. Former royal marine Aldo Kane is given the task of ensuring the team's safety.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Orkney: Britain's Ancient Capital
programme.desc: Andy Torbet dives below the waves in search of the inspiration for the first stone circle, while Chris Packham and Neil Oliver spend the night on an abandoned island as they hunt for clues as to why cultures change. Meanwhile, Shini Somara tests the technology behind a bronze age sauna and the archaeologists uncover a remarkable find.(n)

programme.title: The Marvellous World of Roald Dahl
programme.desc: Documentary making use of archived letters, writings and biographical material to tell the story of the life of Roald Dahl, in his own inimitable voice. From his time as a fighter pilot in the Second World War, through to his work as a spy and his encounters with Walt Disney and Theodore Roosevelt, the programme explores how Dahl's personal experiences may have informed the fantastical tales he would eventually publish, including Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and Matilda. Includes contributions by Dahl's last wife Liccy, his daughter Lucy and biographer Donald Sturrock. Long-term collaborator Quentin Blake also provides new animated illustrations based on the events of Dahl's life.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Kate and Mei Lin get chance to tour the solar system with Pal's cousin, Dr Yowl - but Pal suspects his Plutonian relative is up to no good.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: When the annual sheepdog trials are threatened by torrential rain, the farmer begs the judges not to cancel the show.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM teams up with Jeopardy Mouse crash-land on a desolate planet in space. The pair's inability to work together without bickering places them in great danger.(n)

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mum and Dad go out, leaving Boy in charge of the house.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A mystery illness leaves Topaz the kangaroo unable to hop.(n)

programme.title: Almost Never
programme.desc: Tillie gets a guitar lesson from singer-songwriter Tom Walker.(n)

programme.title: Danny & Mick
programme.desc: Joy wants to open a luxury spa centre at Pottsfield and vlogger Luke Cutforth is the first guest. Danny and Mick must put together a luxury treatment.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework
programme.desc: Children's comedy panel show hosted by Iain Stirling, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Long-running children's magazine programme.(n)

programme.title: Craft Party
programme.desc: Children's programme exploring the ownderful world of crafting..(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: The Ramsay family holds a lip sync music video challenge, while Tilly composes a pop-inspired lunch including tasty and tuneful musical carrots with a kale and artichoke dip.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
